website_summaries.verdict: Full of retro charm; would be great for a wedding or other event. Not a high-end camera, but captures that vintage instant camera experience.
pros: Camera is small and easy to carry
Automatic flash and scenery settings work surprisingly well
focus is sharp, colors are vibrant
cons: Spits out photos that are the size of a business card, not the "classic" Polaroid square

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for teenagers!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this product!! It is great for teenagers who love taking photos. It's easy to work and produces great images. I use it for a memory wall in my room and the polaroid look just makes it extra special. I truly recommend this to anybody who is on the edge about buying one. It is truly a memory maker and to have those little polaroid of you and your friends are priceless.
customer_reviews.author: Happytoes

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, Small pics
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs to know that this camera takes mini pics. The original Polaroid was about 3.5x5.5". These photos are much smaller. Camera performs as expected but it's not going to give you a picture that reveals a lot due to the size.
customer_reviews.author: Curt Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Photo is half the size, but camera is all the rage.
customer_reviews.text: Big and sturdy, batteries last a while. Pictures are about half the size of a "regular" Polaroid camera, which was an unpleasant surprise (I should have read more closely). Otherwise, it behaves just as an old-school Polaroid camera. Bought it as a gift and my kid loves it. Was amusing to think that he thought there was a tiny printer inside the camera that printed the photo... Had to explain photo development...
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: So much fun
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my bbf and Christmas and she loves it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Illa illa

customer_reviews.title: So much fun to use
customer_reviews.text: So much fun to use. Photos are just like the old polaroids. Picture quality and colors aren’t any better but they print instantly and make us nostalgic! Easy enough for a 4 year old to operate.
customer_reviews.author: reviewmire

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with settings!!!
customer_reviews.text: My sister got this camera for me as a birthday gift and I love it! However.... took a while to get used to (and 6 failed pictures). There is a dial on the top with four settings. I assume they determine how dark to make the picture. The instructions clarify how to use the settings and in what light to use them in. All I'm saying is make sure to read the directions before wasting your film. Also, I got the purple one, and it is a tad darker than is shown in the picture. Overall great camera!!
customer_reviews.author: ME Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Price for Quality, Classic-Looking Polaroids!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera. Polaroids come out great quality. Must adjust settings and filters appropriately for lighting, which calls for practice and trial and error. Film is a little pricy. Camera is definitely worth the price for quality, classic-looking polaroid!
customer_reviews.author: kurtis martin ennis

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are not clear, two black dots appear when you take the picture and it is not the film because I changed it several times. Totally disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Luisa

customer_reviews.title: very pleased with camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my daughters 50th Birthday Party....very pleased with camera!
customer_reviews.author: IslandGramGram98282

customer_reviews.title: We need a little guidance... we seem ...
customer_reviews.text: We need a little guidance...we seem to be missing the film cartridge but we're not sure if this was supposed to come with the camera as part of the camera (we would assume) or if we need to purchase it separately? I was under the impression that buying both the camera and the gift set I would have all the bases covered but we do not have a film cartridge. Please advise...
customer_reviews.author: Heather Marie Symons

customer_reviews.title: Thought maybe the film was bad since the flash actually worked but the other pack ...
customer_reviews.text: Opened on Christmas and every shot was black with very little exposure. Thought maybe the film was bad since the flash actually worked but the other pack of film did the same thing. We will be returning this....

customer_reviews.title: Looks like a Toy, but isn't!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: It works, but I think there are better products out there.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I think there are better products out there. Not terribly impressed with the pictures and it tends to be a little problematic when changing batteries and film.

customer_reviews.title: Complete Failure

We reseated the paper, no help. We reached out to support, they were useless. In the end, I had to pay double the amount for a camera from Best Buy but at least it worked. This camera was returned.

Lawson sr.

customer_reviews.title: there's apps that can create a "poloroid" looking photo of better quality. The pictures were grainier than I expected ...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive camera to buy just to use for a few times. The film you need to purchase is too expensive to use this camera often. The functions worked well enough, but really, this day and age, there's apps that can create a "poloroid" looking photo of better quality. The pictures were grainier than I expected and sometimes the colour was off. I guess, Polaroid pictures were always like that. But you'd think with the modern technology it would have gotten better.

product_meta.title: Polaroid PIC-300 Instant Film Camera (Blue)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlueFROM THE MANUFACTURER


 Polaroid Pic-300 Instant Camera Features 

This camera allows you to take pictures you'll see developed in front of your eyes in minutes. It's the modern version of the classic Polaroid instant camera you've grown to love and it's just in time for your wedding, anniversary, birthday or other big event! The Polaroid Pic-300 is great for guest books when you want to put a face on your special day, registration events or any other time when you want quick results you can share within minutes. The camera prints pictures about the size of a business card (1.8 inches x 2.4 inches) on paper that's 2.1 inches x 3.4 inches. 



Easy and fun to use 

To use, simply snap, print, and share your photos - that's it! Take it on the go so you can send friends and family home with pictures of their own within minutes. The film counts down like a disposable camera so you know how many pictures are left before you change the film. 

How instant photos work 

The Polaroid PoGo Zink Photo Paper produces high quality, full-color glossy prints of your favorite photos without a printer and even without ink. The paper features billions of tiny dye crystals embedded within the Zink Paper that are activated by precise heat pulses through the thermal print head within the camera. It's an advanced composite material with cyan, yellow, and magenta dye crystals embedded inside and a protective polymer overcoat layer outside. When heat is applied in just the right way, full color images appear like magic on the paper. The differing paper means you will have a bright and sharp image with just a camera and photo paper - no ink cartridges or ribbons needed. 

Each photo print is dry-to-the-touch, water resistant and features an adhesive back. You can stick your photos to any surface without damaging the photo or the surface. Zink Paper is the heart of ZINK Zero Ink Technology. For easy-to-use photo paper that prints vivid images, the Polaroid PoGo Zink Photo Paper has arrived. You must use Polaroid instant color film only. A film pack includes one black film cover and 10 film sheets. Do not remove the film from its inner bag until immediately before loading it into the camera and keep it out of direct heat. 

Taking a picture in all light settings 

When the camera isn't used for 5 minutes while the power was turned on, all the lamps automatically turn off and the camera enters an energy saving state. The camera can be reset to the, "power on" state by hitting the shutter release button or pushing and pulling the lens section. The Pic-300 uses four AA batteries (must be the same type and size of alkaline batteries). 

What's in the box:  * Pic-300 camera
 * Wrist strap
 * 4 AA batteries

Note: Film not included
